meanings.definition: Pultruded: (verb) to form (a material) into a continuous profile by pulling it through a die.
meanings.sent1: The workers pultruded the fiberglass to create a sturdy beam.
meanings.sent2: The company pultruded the plastic to make durable pipes.
meanings.sent3: The pultruded metal rod decided it wanted to be a fancy sculpture instead.
meanings.sent4: Her determination pultruded through every obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The pultruded shape emerged sleek and strong, like a superhero's armor.

meanings.definition: Pultruded: (adjective) made by the process of pultrusion.
meanings.sent1: The pultruded railing along the staircase was incredibly resilient.
meanings.sent2: The pultruded panels on the building provided excellent insulation.
meanings.sent3: The pultruded chair seemed to have a mind of its own, always adjusting to the sitter's comfort.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pultruded steel, unyielding and sharp.
meanings.sent5: The pultruded structure stood out among the rest, a testament to modern engineering.
